means: [女子名] 查丽蒂来源于拉丁语，含义是“慈善的”(charitable)

sentence.Network_en: Mr Dudley has pledged to give any award to charity.
sentence.Network_cn: 达德利先生已承诺将任何所获的损害赔偿额都捐给慈善机构。

sentence.Network_en: The magistrates granted that the charity was justified in bringing the action.
sentence.Network_cn: 地方法官承认该慈善机构有理由提起诉讼。

sentence.Network_en: The organisers hope to raise as much as £6m for charity.
sentence.Network_cn: 组织者希望能募集到高达600万英镑的善款。

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)a person's first responsibility is for the needs of their own family and friends

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English (in the sense 'Christian love of one's fellows'): from Old French charite, from Latin caritas, from carus 'dear'

entry.def: A charity is an organization which raises money in order to help people who are ill, disabled, or very poor.

example.ex: The National Trust is a registered charity.
example.tran: 全国托管协会是个已注册的慈善机构。

entry.def: If you give money to charity, you give it to one or more charitable organizations. If you do something for charity, you do it in order to raise money for one or more charitable organizations.

example.ex: He made substantial donations to charity...
example.tran: 他为慈善事业捐了很多钱。

example.ex: Gooch will be raising money for charity.

entry.def: People who live on charity live on money or goods which other people give them because they are poor.

example.ex: My mum was very proud. She wouldn't accept charity...
example.tran: 母亲自尊心很强，不会接受施舍。

example.ex: Her husband is unemployed and the family depends on charity.
example.tran: 她丈夫失业了，全家人靠救济金过日子。

entry.def: Charity is kindness and understanding towards other people.
If you say charity begins at home, you mean that people should deal with the needs of people close to them before they think about helping others.

means.word_mean: 1. a foundation created to promote the public good (not for assistance to any particular individuals)
2. a kindly and lenient attitude toward people
3. an activity or gift that benefits the public at large
4. pinnate-leaved European perennial having bright blue or white flowers
5. an institution set up to provide help to the needy

auth_sentence.content: This is - a profitable business, not charity!
auth_sentence.res_content: This is - a profitable business, not charity!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is - a profitable business, not charity!

auth_sentence.content: But the charity is struggling to meet growing needs.
auth_sentence.res_content: But the charity is struggling to meet growing needs.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But the charity is struggling to meet growing needs.

auth_sentence.content: I regularly send my heating allowances to a charity.
auth_sentence.res_content: I regularly send my heating allowances to a charity.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 仁慈的,慈爱的;慷慨施舍的,慈善的
stems_affixes.word_buile: charity[n.慈善[团体],仁慈,施舍]+able能……的→charitable仁慈的
char关心,抚爱+ity某种性质→n.慈善[团体],仁慈,施舍

stems_affixes.value_cn: 抱有,怀有[希望等];爱护,抚育;珍爱
stems_affixes.word_buile: cher=char关心,抚爱+ish表动词→v.抱有,怀有[希望等];爱护,抚育;珍爱

Sentence.sentence: She made huge donations to charities.
Better skip dinner or hit the gym afterwards, with a cancer charity warning that some iced coffees contain as many calories as a hot dinner.

sentences.en: These homeless children received some money and clothes from some charities.
sentences.cn: 一些无家可归的孩子收到了来自一些慈善机构的钱和衣物。

means.word_mean: 宽厚, 宽容, 宽大

jushi.english: The victims of the disaster lived on charity until they could make new lives for themselves.
jushi.chinese: 灾民靠救济金过活,直到他们能重整家园为止。

jushi.english: She gave the old woman some pairs of shoes out of charity.
jushi.chinese: 她出于善心给了老妇人几双鞋。

jushi.english: The flood victims received money and clothes from several charities.
jushi.chinese: 水灾灾民收到了几个慈善团体捐赠的钱和衣服。
